meanings.definition: Involving only one side or party
meanings.sent1: The unilateral decision was made without consulting anyone else.
meanings.sent2: The treaty was a unilateral agreement between the two countries.
meanings.sent3: It was a bit funny how the unilateral choice surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her unilateral actions spoke volumes about her independence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's unilateral rule made the classroom atmosphere tense.

meanings.definition: Done by or affecting only one side
meanings.sent1: The unilateral trade restrictions hurt both countries.
meanings.sent2: The unilateral ceasefire brought temporary peace to the region.
meanings.sent3: The unilateral decision to wear mismatched socks was a bold fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: His unilateral approach to problem-solving was both efficient and effective.
meanings.sent5: The unilateral painting on the wall caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Decided by only one person or group
meanings.sent1: The unilateral choice to change the menu was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent2: The unilateral declaration of independence sparked a revolution.
meanings.sent3: The unilateral decision to have a picnic in the rain was questionable.
meanings.sent4: Her unilateral control over the project ensured its success.
meanings.sent5: The unilateral order to evacuate saved many lives during the storm.
